1.content:
Ageless Andrew

Introduction

Andrew Denny came to the old, abandoned house with his mother, June. June has a job cleaning houses, while she tries to raise Andy as a single mom who just recently got divorced.

Andy is only 12 years old, and he has an abundance of curiosity, fantasy and imagination. He is outgoing and talkative, and he loves to try new things.

Today, June Denny had taken Andy with her, so that she wouldn’t have to get a baby sitter for him. She had an old house to clean, and she had already gotten some money for the job.

The owner of the house was an elderly man who had recently passed away. The man had no children and his wife had died many years earlier. June had to clean the old house, and she had taken Andy with her.

Andy was bored to tears, while he sat in the chair in the living room. He could only watch while his mother mopped the floor and dusted the big, wooden table. She had yet to wash all the windows and clean the bathrooms.

Andy became restless and began to wander around.

“Mom… Can I go over to the neighbors, next door? I want to see who else lives here!” Andy asked his mom, as he wandered around the big house. He opened a closet door and noted stacks of books, papers and boxes all over.

“No, Andy… You’re too young to go out all by yourself, and you know that!” June replied.

Andy spotted some model cars and figures in the closet. He also saw some small toys, which had probably belonged to some little girl, who had lived there many years earlier.

“Can I go to that bedroom at the end of the hall, mommy? I think there are some little toys in there… I want to check them out…” he chuckled.

“No, Andy… Leave them alone. Besides, you’re too old to play with little toys!”

“I’m too old for this, too young for that…” Andy sighed, as he walked over to the large, wooden desk. He curiously opened the large, desk drawer and saw that it was filled with small items and knick-knacks.

In the desk he found a small box, about 1 inch square on all sides. The box was old and dusty. When he removed the lid, he found a bright, blue amulet, which was a stone shaped like a diamond. On it was engraved the word “Ageless”.

“A talisman!” he cheered. “I’m taking that with me!” he said, as placed the talisman in the box, and then he hid the box in his pocket.

“Don’t touch anything! Andy!” June shouted. “There’s nothing here for you to play with! You’re too young to be messing with these things!”

“I’m always too young for everything…. Ugh!” Andy groaned, as he walked back to the kitchen where June was just finishing up. “Are you almost done? Can we go now?”

“Yes, I’m finished…”

June finally walked out and locked the front door. Then, she took Andy by the hand, as they walked back to the car.

Andy was very happy to get out of there, but he was even more excited that he had taken a souvenir with him.

As soon as Andy got home, he got some fishing wire. He ran the wire through the amulet, and then he tied it around his neck, so it could not be removed. He figured that, since it was an amulet, it would bring him good luck!

What happens when he wears the amulet?
